Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Imam Konate Souleimane, Masjid Aqsa, 2136 8th Avenue, New York, N.Y. 

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Foster.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Imam Konate Souleimane, Mashid Asqa, 2136 8th Avenue, New York, N.Y.

Council Member Foster moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 290 Hudson Street, CB 2, Application no. 20095598 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, RRBV Associates LLC d/b/a Harbor NY, Manhattan (20095598TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Brewer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 885-889 10th Avenue (Greek Kitchen, Inc.), Borough if Manhattan,  CB 4, Application no. 20095133 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 885-889 Tenth Avenue, Manhattan (20095133TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 107-02 70th Road (Aged Bar and Grill), CB 6, Application no. 20095695 TCQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, A & A Food Enterprises LLC d/b/a. Aged Bar N Grill, Queens (20095695TCQ)

Items.MatterName: Times Square Business Improvement District

Items.Title: General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the City University of New York (“CUNY”) to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed school holidays throughout the CUNY system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: City University of New York (“CUNY”) to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed school holidays throughout the CUNY system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R. 22, the “United States Postal Service Financial Relief Act of 2009,” which would amend chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, to allow the United States Postal Service to pay its share of contributions for annuitants' health benefits out of the Postal Service Retiree Health Benefits Fund.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass H.R. 22, the “United States Postal Service Financial Relief Act of 2009”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R. 1686, the “Mail Network Protection Act of 2009,” which would provide for the protection and integrity of the United States mail.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass H.R. 1686, the “Mail Network Protection Act of 2009”.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of paid sick time earned by employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Provision of paid sick time earned by employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to change the policy that places responsibility on the child to notify the bus driver or escort when the adult who is designated to pick them up from the bus stop is not present.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to change the policy that places responsibility on the child to notify the bus driver or escort when the adult who is designated to pick them up from the bus stop is not present.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to crane safety.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Crane Safety

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspension of licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Suspension of licenses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to reduce the unnecessary use of private contractors and consultants to perform public services typically performed by civil servants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Reduce the unnecessary use of private contractors and consultants to perform public services typically performed by civil servants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to controlling emissions from businesses located in mixed-use buildings that use chemicals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Controlling emissions from businesses located in mixed-use buildings that use chemicals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notice of major transportation projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Notice of major street construction projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the required signage warning of heat dangers of playground equipment, including safety surfacing.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Required signage warning of heat dangers of playground equipment, including safety surfacing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allocation of bus stops to private bus companies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allocation of bus stops to private bus companies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing a biotechnology credit against the general corporation tax, and the unincorporated business tax.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Providing a biotechnology credit against the general corporation tax, and the unincorporated business tax.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to plastic garment bags used by dry cleaning establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Plastic garment bags used by dry cleaning establishments.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Filing of registration statements by owners of dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass A. 2565 and the Governor to sign A. 2565 and its companion bill, S. 2664, legislation that would amend the Social Services Law to provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV/AIDS, and who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance, shall not be required to pay more than 30% of their household’s monthly income towards shelter costs, including rent and utilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the Social Services Law to provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV/AIDS, and who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance, shall not be required to pay more than 30% of their household’s monthly income tow
